irb_consent.title: Research Study Information
text: You are invited to participate in a research study about wildfire evacuation decision-making.
Your participation is voluntary. You may stop at any time without penalty.
Your responses will be kept confidential and used for research purposes only.
This study involves reviewing information and making decisions in a simulated wildfire scenario.

contact_screen.title: Contact Information (Optional)
text: If you are willing, you may provide contact information so we can follow up with you about this study.
Providing contact information is optional and not required to participate.

scenario_description.title: Wildfire Evacuation Scenario
text: You are at home during a wildfire event in your area.
Over the next several hours, conditions may worsen.
You will receive information from different sources.
At each stage, review the available information and decide what you would do.

-5.text: Faint smoke visible on the horizon.

-4.text: Smoke clearly visible in the area.

-6.text: Red Flag Warning issued for the area.

-5.text: Fire Weather Watch remains in effect.

-4.text: Evacuation Warning issued for nearby zones.

-2.text: Mandatory Evacuation Order issued for adjacent areas.

-1.text: Mandatory Evacuation Order expanded. Leave immediately.

-3.text: Family: Are you thinking of leaving?

-6.text: Breaking news: Wildfire reported in nearby foothills.

-4.text: Update: Fire growing rapidly with strong winds.

-3.text: Live coverage: Evacuations underway in nearby communities.

-2.text: Officials urge residents to follow evacuation orders.

-1.text: Breaking: Major roads closing due to fire activity.

-6.text: Roads are clear and traffic is normal.

-4.text: Light congestion reported on main routes.

-3.text: Stop and go traffic on evacuation routes.

-2.text: Heavy congestion and multiple road closures.

-1.text: Gridlock on major exits from the area.

-3.text: Cell service intermittent in some areas.

-2.text: Water pressure reduced in parts of the community.
Waiting for someone to return home.

-4.text: County shelter opened at fairgrounds (pets allowed).

-3.text: Shelter filling quickly; limited space remaining.

-2.text: Shelter at capacity. Alternate shelter 30 miles east.

-1.text: All nearby shelters full. Consider staying with friends or family.

-5.text: Fire crews staged in nearby areas.

-3.text: Fire engines visible in the neighborhood.

-2.text: Emergency personnel redirected to active fire lines.

-1.text: No emergency crews visible in residential streets.

-5.text: Some neighbors outside watching the smoke.

-2.text: Most homes on the street appear empty.

-1.text: Only a few cars remain in the neighborhood.

-6.text: You can message people you know.

-5.text: You can message people you know.

-4.text: You can message people you know.

-3.text: You can message people you know.

-2.text: You can message people you know.

-1.text: You can message people you know.

-4.text: Public buses running on normal schedule.

-3.text: Evacuation buses announced at community center.

-2.text: Limited bus capacity; long waits reported.

-1.text: Bus service suspended due to road closures.

-3.text: Some evacuation routes flagged as congested.

-2.text: Navigation apps rerouting frequently due to closures.

-1.text: Multiple routes marked closed or unreliable.

-5.text: You consider securing windows and valuables.

-4.text: Concern about leaving pets or property unattended.

-3.text: Worry about potential looting after evacuation.

-2.text: Time pressure limits ability to prepare your home.

-5.text: Online post claims the fire is mostly contained.

-4.text: Rumor circulating that evacuation orders may be downgraded.

-3.text: Conflicting reports about which roads are open.

-2.text: Unverified claim that the fire changed direction.

-1.text: False report suggests the neighborhood is safe.

cautious_friend.-6: I heard about the fire, but it still sounds pretty far away.
cautious_friend.-5: It smells smoky here too. I'm watching the updates.
cautious_friend.-4: Some people nearby are packing, but I haven't decided yet.
cautious_friend.-3: Traffic is starting to look bad. If you go, sooner is probably better.
cautious_friend.-2: This is getting serious. I think leaving is the safer option.
cautious_friend.-1: You really should leave now if you haven't already.

skeptical_friend.-6: Fires happen every year. I wouldn't stress yet.
skeptical_friend.-5: Officials tend to overreact with these warnings.
skeptical_friend.-4: I'm staying put. The fire still seems far.
skeptical_friend.-3: Traffic is worse than the fire in my opinion.
skeptical_friend.-2: I'm still not convinced evacuation is necessary.
skeptical_friend.-1: If you're calm at home, staying might be fine.

alarmist_friend.-6: I don't like this at all. Fires spread fast.
alarmist_friend.-5: Smoke already worries me. I'd start getting ready.
alarmist_friend.-4: If you wait too long, roads will be packed.
alarmist_friend.-3: I would leave now if you can.
alarmist_friend.-2: This is dangerous. You should be evacuating.
alarmist_friend.-1: Please tell me you're already on your way out.
